lead_intro: Discover the implications of the Turkish referendum and the shift to a presidential system. Are you ready to test your understanding?

quiz.question: In the old system, how long is the term for the President of Turkey?
quiz.explanation: In the old system, the President of Turkey served a 5-year term.

quiz.question: What major change will occur in Turkey's elections after the referendum?
choices: The President and Parliament will be elected on different days
The President and Parliament will be elected on the same day
The President will be appointed by the Parliament
quiz.answer: The President and Parliament will be elected on the same day
quiz.explanation: Following the referendum, Turkey's President and Parliament will be elected on the same day.

quiz.question: How does the new constitution impact the position of Prime Minister in Turkey?
choices: The Prime Minister will have more power
The Prime Minister will be appointed by the President
There will be no Prime Minister
quiz.answer: There will be no Prime Minister
quiz.explanation: Under the new constitution, the position of Prime Minister will be eliminated in Turkey.

quiz.question: What is one concern critics have about the shift to a presidential system in Turkey?
choices: The President will have too little power
The balance of powers will be compromised
Laws will be approved more efficiently
quiz.answer: The balance of powers will be compromised
quiz.explanation: Critics fear that the shift to a presidential system in Turkey may compromise the balance of powers.

quiz.question: How will the composition of the Turkish Supreme Board of judges and prosecutors change in the future?
choices: More members appointed by the Parliament
More members appointed by the President
quiz.answer: More members appointed by the President
quiz.explanation: In the future, the Turkish Supreme Board of judges and prosecutors will have more members appointed by the President.
